body:
This seems like it's doing two different things.

I think the fix you want could be applied [here](https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/blob/master/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/TextIO.java#L641): just throw if numShards is set (or however we detect this). And similarly in AvroIO -- these are the only places that have a notion of sharding in Beam.

I think the check you've added here is great but we should make the error message more appropriate.
R: @dhalperi

We can't fail there as we need to support this for the Dataflow and Direct runners. 

Do you have a better suggestion for an error message?
That code should not be reached for Dataflow and Direct runners, which override the transform at application time.

I thought we didn't intercept apply() calls during pipeline construction
depending on the runner anymore.

On Wed, Jun 8, 2016 at 4:40 PM, Daniel Halperin notifications@github.com
wrote:

> That code should not be reached for Dataflow and Direct runners.
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/436#issuecomment-224763627,
> or mute the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe/AAdqgYLtkqcDZK3lebFCQ-Ihb5fL6es4ks5qJ1MAgaJpZM4IxczJ
> .

My suggested error message:

``` java
int numDistinctShards = new HashSet<String>(destFilenames).size();
checkState(numDistinctShards == numFiles,
    "Shard name template '%s' only generated %s distinct file names for %s files.",
    fileNamingTemplate, numDistinctShards, numFiles);
```

The difficulty with this error message is that it's not very actionable.
The root cause is (almost certainly) lack of support for numShards.

On Wed, Jun 8, 2016 at 4:45 PM, Daniel Halperin notifications@github.com
wrote:

> My suggested error message:
> 
> int numDistinctShards = new HashSet<String>(destFilenames).size();
> checkState(numDistinctShards == numFiles,
>     "Shard name template '%s' only generated %d distinct file names for %d files.",
>     fileNamingTemplate, numDistinctShards, numFiles);
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/436#issuecomment-224764413,
> or mute the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe/AAdqge90pWowzMHo5GrQcZCaMC0hcgSpks5qJ1QjgaJpZM4IxczJ
> .
No way -- I think you may have caught a real bug here, if the user provided a shard template like `SSS-of-NNN` and we generated 10K files. That's worth calling out on its own.
R: @tgroh @bjchambers

@aljoscha it fixes the bug on the example project I've prepared. Could not break it.

I'm still getting incorrect results on my original dataset though (but the number of number of incorrectly grouped items has shrunk by factor of 2). I'll examine my code in detail. I don't think it should be a stopper.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/5831146/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/5831146)

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.

The number of digits is a lower, not upper, bound so 10K files would be fine. 

I've changed the error, the most important thing to me is that it's not a silent data loss. Also added a test.

R: @amitsela adding you as I ended up noodling with the Spark streaming tests.

In summary, I replace the use of `PAssert` with just a custom transform that does the assertion. I believe the use cases are beyond those actually supported by `PAssert` today, but will be handled well in the upcoming improvements to `PAssert`.

Aww man, the gift that keeps on giving... ðŸ˜… 

@orian Am I correct in assuming that it fixes the bug for all the cases in your provided example? For large payloads and large numbers of keys/records? Would it be possible for you to send me the data for which it fails and the program? Or an approximation if you can't send the original data/program.
@aljoscha Yes, you're correct. I'll send you the data and the code (just need to clean it a bit).

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/5832071/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/5832071)

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.

Updated. I added explanations on each test.
However, I have two points:
1. Using `ZipInputStream` there's not way to get the number of entries. So, unfortunately, I don't see a good way to raise an exception when the zip stream contains multiple entries.
2. In the `testZipCompressedReadWithEmptyFile` test, I got the right `IllegalArgumentException` but wrapped in a `RuntimeException`. That's why I'm doing `expectedException.expect(RuntimeException.class)` instead of `expectedException.expect(IllegalArgumentException.class)`. Any idea why ?
R: @lukecwik
LGTM
LGTM, thanks.
OK, I've fixed up all the issues that this change uncovered and the tests are happy in Jenkins. Please take a look when you get a chance.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/5833015/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/5833015)

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.
R: @dhalperi

This PR contains a lot of other commits, it looks like. Can you please rebase on top of master and force-push?

This assumes you followed the `remote` naming scheme from the Beam contribution guide:

``` sh
git fetch --all
git rebase apache/master
git log apache/master..    # this should only show your changes
git push -f ianzhou1 HEAD:beam
```
R: @bjchambers
LGTM. Please update the first line of the description to make it clear this is for an example. I'll wait for Jenkins/Travis.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/5834777/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/5834777)

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.
Updated commit message; will need to wait for Jenkins.

R: @dhalperi
CC: @eljefe6a I picked & squashed the commits from your #442; you are credited appropriately here.

One thing I waffle on is whether and how much to layer coders. For example, the `BigDecimalCoder` could directly invoke `BigIntegerCoder`, which in turn could use `ByteArrayCoder`. To some extent, I actually don't want them to depend on each other, in case the formats change.

But if they do change, it may be for a good reason. And yet invalidating many coder binary formats silently seems risky.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/5834555/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/5834555)

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.
LGTM for the general code once comments are addressed and Jenkins/Travis look good.

OK, then I'll wait to hear from @amitsela to see if I have botched something in Spark land before proceeding.

I also had some performance concern, but I think it was an anomaly. This may actually speed things up a smidgin.

R: @aljoscha @davorbonaci 

Assuming this is going to cause some failures that we'll need to filter out or fix.

LGTM, this replaces https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/406 right ?
~~Are the performance concerns related to the Spark runner ?~~ Just watched Jenkins in "Live", Spark runner tests look fine and times seem OK.

Note that I did not try to solve the problem of properly sharing the configuration. I am to blame for duplicating it, in response to it seeming not to propagate correctly between modules. It does need to be revamped. I also think the polarity of the activation of the execution should be reversed.

Can you rebase onto `master` and include only the commits specific to this PR?

R: @kennknowles

I only just realized that the bits in #437 are essentially addressing the same thing as here. Sorry for the duplication. Given the comments here, I will go for lazy consensus on #437 and merge it in perhaps 24 hours from now.
Awesome. We are playing comment tag; just commented on #406, which this does supersede.
LGTM, it looks like "karma" was against us here anyway.. ðŸ˜•

Jenkins failed, but due to test timeout:

> [INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

> Build timed out (after 100 minutes). Marking the build as aborted.
> Build was aborted
> channel stopped
> Putting comment on the pull request

Travis is green so far..
Travis is done and green; Jenkins only failed due to timeout. PTAL @bjchambers
Superseded by https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/437
@dpmills you didn't LGTM this --  can you take a detailed review (or LGTM if done)?

R: @peihe -@dhalperi

Let's share the load a bit :)
In fact, I added the test group setting without expanding the set of test classifier dependencies. I am making a more comprehensive revision. Closing.

The earlier Travis failures seem to have been because Travis dislikes me. 3 additional successes

https://travis-ci.org/tgroh/incubator-beam/builds/136579107
https://travis-ci.org/tgroh/incubator-beam/builds/136579169
https://travis-ci.org/tgroh/incubator-beam/builds/136579179

@kennknowles

Thanks @dhalperi 
PTAL
LGTM. Will merge since the test timing looks reasonable.
Pretty exciting. Looks like the current status causes a bug in the Java 7 compilers on Linux & Mac :-)
Please take another look. This can actually save many minutes for anyone using command-line `mvn`, which I have to do once in a while.
I see you have BEAM-??? in your title. Is there a ticket filed about this, so I can gain context on it? Just for my own edification.

The release has branched off, so let's resume!

The findbugs complaints in the logs there look legitimate. I find the error message that `equals` "is unusual" kind of amusing. `PAssert` has been changed significantly, so after a rebase it will likely look different.

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.
The travis builds are failing with an exception in the compiler, I don't think we can check this in.
Yes, I likely need to re-generate the baseline file based on recent development.

Note: these are backwards-incompatible changes. This needs a `DataflowPipelineRunner` change to update the [worker container](https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/blob/master/runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/DataflowPipelineRunner.java#L222) to a version that understands these changes.
Looks good, done for the first pass.

I thought about doing both the BigInteger and BigDecimal at the same time when I wrote this. You're seeing they're very related. My idea was to have BigDecimal use BigInteger as part of its implementation. For BigDecimal, you'd just need to add an integer for scale.
@kennknowles Cleaned up commits as best I could. My Git-fu isn't strong enough.

R: @dhalperi 
CC: @kennknowles
Don't we also want this in the starter module in addition to the examples module?

Thanks Pei & Jesse!

I'll grab a different committer to give the final sign off.

R: -@peihe @lukecwik
Hopefully you can get all the way there just with `git rebase -i` and then delete all but the one or two commits for this PR.
My impression is that you want only c1a3bc5 and adfeb01

R: @lukecwik -@dhalperi

Luke should review this and make sure it's all set.
Agreed. Really curious.

R: @bjchambers 
CC: @dhalperi
Looks like it is just a total bug, not fixed until Java 8: https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8022161

Ok, this is finally working. @lukecwik PTAL

Verified by locally changing the Beam pom.xml versions from 0.1-incubating-SNAPSHOT to 0.1-incubating, installing, and running the following commands:

mvn archetype:generate -DarchetypeGroupId=org.apache.beam   -DarchetypeArtifactId=beam-sdks-java-maven-archetypes-examples   -DgroupId=com.example -DartifactId=second-dataflow -Dversion="[1.0.0,2.0.0)"   -DinteractiveMode=false

mvn compile exec:java \
  -Dexec.mainClass=com.example.WordCount \
  -Dexec.args="--project=cloud-millwheel \
  --stagingLocation=gs://dataflow-cloud-millwheel/staging/ \
  --output=gs://dataflow-cloud-millwheel/output \
  --runner=BlockingDataflowPipelineRunner"
Forward port of https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/DataflowJavaSDK/pull/297
LGTM

Backport: https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/DataflowJavaSDK/pull/302

Yes, sorry. I failed to click the "comment" button after writing this:

Good news! In #437 I switched `PAssert` so it no longer uses side inputs in most cases, but instead uses globally-windowed `GroupByKey`. Now almost all runners will be able to use `PAssert` from an early stage. You should be able to use `TestPipeline` and `PAssert` to test your runner using the test suite we provide.

But even before that, we can merge such a major development as this new runner into a feature branch as soon as it has some viability, so everyone has a place to collaborate. Since this runner does have tests that run some real pipelines, that is enough for a feature branch. After that, the criteria for merging into master are outlined in [this email from Frances](http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/incubator-beam-dev/201605.mbox/%3CCAAzyFAxcmexUQnbF%3DYk0PLmM3f5e5BqwJz4%2BC5doRucLNxOh8w%40mail.gmail.com%3E).

So, first, we need to get the tests happy then we can merge into a feature branch. I will also give this another review right away.

Since this is postcommit build breakage, I am going to merge to restore that signal. Please do review when you get a chance. (Assigned to you as reporter, to review what it is that addresses the issue you noticed)
It's the beamTestPipelineOptions variable being propagated improperly (due to `-DforkCount=0`)

Looks like `-Xpkginfo:nonempty` is not going to cut it, so the idea of incremental builds requires littering annotations. I don't feel like doing that, so I'm just going to give up on fixing the build.
